questions.question: The maximum generated voltage in power generating stations in advanced countries is 33kV while that in India is _________
The transmission lines and feeders are _____________ .
The transmission lines are _____________
________ are lines conductors which connect the distribution substations to the areas, to be fed by those distribution substations.
________ are the terminals which connect the consumer's terminals to the distributors
In AC-system ,

answers.a: Electric power can be generated at high voltage
answers.b: Stepping-up and stepping down of an AC voltage can be done easily and efficiently with the help of transformers
answers.c: Transformer line construction is comparatively difficult and the amount of copper required is comparatively more

questions.question: In AC system,

answers.a: There is a need to synchronize the alternators before they are put in parallel
answers.b: As a result of skin effect, the resistance of the line is increased
answers.c: In order to avoid corona loss and also to provide adequate amount of insulation in case of overhead lines, more spacing between the conductors is required

questions.question:
Statement 1:- The best method is to use AC system for generation and distribution purpose and DC system for transmission purpose.
Statement 2:- The best method is to use DC system for generation and distribution purpose and AC system for transmission purpose.

answers.a: Statement 1 is true and Statement 2 is false
answers.b: Statement 1 is false and Statement 2 is false
answers.c: Statement 1 is false and Statement 2 is true
answers.d: Statement 1 is false and Statement 2 is false

questions.question: Underground cables are rarely used for
Important component of overhead lines is
The characteristics that conductors used for transmission and distribution should posses :

answers.a: High tensile strength and low sensitivity

questions.question: Hard drawing of copper __________ electrical conductivity by small amount but it ___________ the tensile strength considerably.

answers.c: Both Increases, decreases and Decreases, increases in some cases

questions.question: Copper conductor is

answers.b: Highly durable and has high scrap value
answers.c: It has high current density, so lesser X-sectional area of conductor is required

questions.question: Aluminium is ______________ in weight as compared to copper, but has _________ conductivity and tensile strength.
The sag in aluminium conductors is __________ the copper conductors.
The advantages of using aluminium conductors steel reinforced over aluminium conductor is ________

answers.c: Both Tensile strength is increased and Skin effect is greatly increased

questions.question: Choose the proper set of increases order of mechanical strength of the following line supports :

answers.a: Wooden poles > steel poles > steel towers > R.C.C poles
answers.b: Wooden poles > steel towers > steel poles > R.C.C poles
answers.c: Wooden poles > steel poles >R.C.C poles > steel towers
answers.d: Wooden poles > R.C.C poles >steel poles > steel towers

questions.question: Characteristics of an insulator used in overhead lines are

answers.a: It should have high electric strength
answers.b: High ratio of rapture strength to flash over voltage

questions.question: A good porcelain insulator has compressive strength of about _________ and dielectric strength of _________ of its thickness.
Glass insulators, can be used up to _________ under normal atmospheric conditions, and in dry atmosphere, it can be used up to __________.
Steatite is produced by mixing ___________ with small proton of ________ and ___________.
In a pin type insulator,

answers.a: Insulators made of glass are generally used for low voltages
answers.b: Insulators made of poralain can be used up to a 90kv but are rarely used on lines above 60kV
answers.c: Both Insulators made of glass are generally used for low voltages and Insulators made of poralain can be used up to a 90kv but are rarely used on lines above 60kV

questions.question: The factor affecting the sag in overhead lines are
Due to skin effect, the total resistance of the conductor _________, as the frequency of the current ________ and also with the increases in the diameter of the conductor.
The skin effect is negligible when the supply frequency is ________ and the conductor diameter is _________.

The alternating magnetic flues in a conductor caused by the current flowing in a neighbouring conductor gives rise to circulating currents which cause an apparent increases in the resistance of the conductor. This phenomena is called ________ .
The factor which effect skin and proximity effects are ______________

answers.c: Size of the conductor and distance between the conductors

questions.question: Usually in short transmission lines ___________

answers.c: Both Length is less than 50km and Operating voltage is less than 20kV

questions.question: In medium transmission lines

answers.c: Both Length is between 50 km and 160km and Operating voltage is between 21kV and 100kV

questions.question: In long transmission lines

answers.c: Both Length is more than 160km and Operating voltage is above 100kV
